revised_title: The Apparent Direction of Eyes in Portraits and the Influence of Facial Features
tldr: The author investigates the factors that influence our perception of the direction of eyes in portraits. They discover that the apparent direction of the eyes is not solely determined by the shape of the iris but is also influenced by the position of the facial features. The author demonstrates this through various experiments with portraits, showing how the turn of the face can alter the apparent direction of the eyes.
scientific_discipline: Art and Humanities > Art and Perception
